name: armourer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who makes, repairs, and supplies weapons: A skilled armourer can reactivate a deactivated submachine gun of this type in as little as two hours.
in the past, a person who made or supplied armour (= strong coverings worn by soldiers, etc. to protect the body): The king called his armourers to him before the battle.
a person who is officially in charge of the weapons of a military ship or regiment (= a large group of soldiers within an army): He signed on as an armourer on the ship.
a person who is in charge of weapons used in making a film, television programme, or other performance: The Royal Opera House took on an armourer to look after weapons used during its productions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe explosion killed two ground crew, an armourer and an engine fitter. The incendiaries scattered over the airfield had to be picked up and made safe by armourers.The equipment and methods used by armourers in the past were not the same as those of ordinary blacksmiths.The armourer on the set was questioned after the fatal accident.
